_header: When all this fresh fellowship were come to Canterbury
_description: The Tale of Beryn, with a Prologue of ‘the mery adventure of the Pardonere and Tapstere at the Inn at Canterbury’ — Prologue of 732 lines in couplets, and Tale of 4024 lines in couplets.

Alnwick455.First Lines:
When all this ffressh feleship were com to CauntirburyAs ye have
                    herd to fore with talys glad & mery…
Alnwick455.Last Lines:
…Now God graunt grace to fynde such a frendeWhen wee have nede
                    and thus I make an ende
Alnwick455.Attributed Title:
Nomen Auctoris presentis Cronica RomeEt tranlationis ffilius
                        ecclesie Thome (f. 237)
